notes: Lemieux is dealing with an undisclosed injury and is going to be out a while, coach Rod Brind'Amour told Cory Lavalette of the North State Journal.
Chisholm wasn't on the ice for Wednesday's (Oct. 9) practice due to an illness, Michael Russo of The Athletic reports.
The Toronto Maple Leafs placed G Joseph Woll on injured reserve.
Boqvist did not return to Tuesday's (Oct. 8) game versus the Boston Bruins after taking a puck to the face.
Saros is dealing with a lower-body injury and is questionable for Thursday's home game against Dallas, per Robby Stanley of NHL.com.
The New Jersey Devils placed F Adam Beckman on injured reserve.
The St. Louis Blues placed D Adam Jiricek on injured reserve.
The Colorado Avalanche placed D Tucker Poolman on long-term injured reserve. He has not appeared in a game since 2002.

The Utah Hockey Club placed Douglas on injured reserve.
The Utah Hockey Club placed F Sam Lipkin on injured reserve.
Guentzel is not practicing on Tuesday after leaving early the previous day, per Daily Faceoff-Fantasy.
Anderson-Dolan was summoned from the minors and placed on injured reserve.
Struble will not participate in Wednesday's (Oct. 9) game and will be evaluated on a daily basis.
Schmidt did not play in Tuesday (Oct. 8) versus the Boston Bruins.

The San Jose Sharks placed D Lucas Carlsson on Injured Reserved.
The Boston Bruins placed D Ian Mitchell on the Injured Reserve.
Clarke is expected to miss about a month with a lower-body injury, Dylan Loucks of The Hockey News reports Saturday.
Jenner (undisclosed) will start the 2024-25 season on injured reserve.
Peterka returned to Buffalo's practice in full on Wednesday (Oct. 9), per Lance Lysowski of Daily Faceoff-Fantasy.
Benson returned to Buffalo's practice in full on Wednesday (Oct. 9), per Matthew Fairburn of Daily Faceoff-Fantasy.
The Buffalo Sabres placed Nicolas Aube-Kubel on injured reserve.
McCabe is considered day-to-day with an upper-body injury, per Daily Faceoff - Fantasy.
Robertson is day-to-day with an upper-body injury, per Daily-Faceoff Fantasy.
The Florida Panthers placed F Justin Sourdif on injured reserve.
Poitras did not play in Tuesday (Oct. 8) versus the Florida Panthers.
The Toronto Maple Leafs placed F Calle Jarnkrok on the Injured Reserve.
Ryan was late to practice on Friday and only participated in a few drills after it was announced that he was day-to-day with an undisclosed injury.
The Pittsburgh Penguins placed F Bryan Rust on injured reserve.
The Golden Knights placed Karlsson on injured reserve.
Campbell will be away from the Red Wings for an indefinite period of time after it was announced Friday that he has entered the NHL/NHLPA Player Assistance Program.
The Chicago Blackhawks placed Kaiser on injured reserve.
The Columbus Blue Jackets placed Voronkov on injured reserve.
Brindley has been placed on injured reserve and is expected to miss 4 to 6 weeks.
The Pittsburgh Penguins placed F Blake Lizotte on injured reserve.
Suter is expected to miss Vancouver's season opener on Wednesday (Oct. 9) versus Calgary Flames, per Iain MacIntyre of Daily Faceoff - Fantasy.

Grosenick underwent successful surgery to repair a torn anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee and will not play this season. He is expected to make a full recovery and be ready for the start of the 2025-26 season.
Celebrini left Tuesday's (Oct. 1) game with a lower body injury after crashing into the boards in the second period.
The Montral Canadiens placed F Patrik Laine on injured reserve.
Reinbacher underwent surgery to his left knee this morning and is out 5-to-6 months.
Ponomarev was placed on season-opening injured reserve.
The Pittsburgh Penguins placed G Alex Nedeljkovic on injured reserve.

Pospisil missed a third straight day of practice on Saturday, per Wes Gilbertson of the Calgary Sun.

D Artyom Levshunov is not expected to play in any preseason games. As per Scott Powers of The Athletic.

Bjugstad will be listed as week-to-week and is not taking part in the start of training camp, per Craig Morgan of ALLCITY Network.

Marino is considered week-to-week with an upper-body injury and will not be on the ice Thursday for the start of training camp, according to Craig Morgan of ALLCITY Network.
Oshie will be put on long-term injured reserve due to a chronic back injury that's expected to cost him the entire 2024-25 campaign, per Tom Gulitti of NHL.com.
Jason Robertson participated in Saturday's practice. Coach Alain Nasreddine remains optimistic about his readiness for the season opener, per NHL TV Analyst Brent Severyn.
The Pittsburgh Penguins placed F Matt Nieto on the long-term injured reserve.
The Edmonton Oilers placed F Evander Kane on long-term injured reserve.
Glendening could return by the Oct. 11 opener, Tampa Bay Lightning GM Julien BriseBois said.
Eyssimont was originally expected to be out until the middle of October, but he removed his non-contact jersey for Thursday's practice.
The Vancouver Canucks placed F Dakota Joshua on the Injured Reserve.
The Colorado Avalanche placed F Artturi Lehkonen on the Injured Reserve.
The New Jersey Devils placed Luke Hughes on injured reserve.
Krug will undergo surgery on his left ankle and will miss the entire 2024-25 season.
The carolina Hurricanes placed D Riley Stillman on the Injured Reserve.
Brossoit underwent meniscus repair surgery yesterday, out 5-7 weeks, which puts him back late end of training camp or beginning of regular season, per Frank Seravalli of Daily Faceoff.
The San Jose Sharks placed F Igor Chernyshov on Injured Reserved.
Harvey-Pinard was placed on long-term injured reserve, per PuckPedia.
Nichushkin was placed in Stage 3 of the NHL/NHLPA player assistance program and suspended for a minimum of six months without pay for violating the terms of Stage 2, the NHL and NHLPA announced.

The Avalanche placed Landeskog on long-term injured reserve.
